register.description: The peripheral identification register is a constant register that contains the ID and ID revision number for that module. The PID stores version information used to identify the module. All bits within this register are read-only (writes have no effect) meaning that the values within this register should be hard-coded with the appropriate values and must not change from their hard-coded values.

bitfield.description: RTL revision. Will vary depending on release

register.description: This register contains global control to PSC.

bitfield.description: General purpose IO/Analog PowerDown control. Directly drives io_ana_pdctl_po[7:0] outputs.

register.description: This register shows the PSC global status.
This register has no storage. Read from this register returns 0.
This register records pending error conditions for all modules. Each bit represents one module (index 0 for modules 0-31, index 1 for modules 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Records pending error conditions. Each bit n represents a module.

register.description: This register has no storage. Read from this register returns 0. Each bit represents one module (index 0 for modules 0-31, index 1 for modules 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Write of 1 clears the corresponding MERRPR bit.

register.description: This register records pending error conditions for each power domain. Each bit represents one domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Power Domain n Error Condition. Each bit n represents a power domain.

register.description: This register has no storage. Read from this register returns 0. Each bit represents one domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Write of 1 clears the corresponding PERRPR bit.

register.description: This register records pending external power control conditions. Each bit represents one domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: External Power Control Intervention Request for Power Domain n

register.description: This register has no storage. Read from this register returns 0. Each bit represents one domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Write of 1 clears the corresponding EPCPR bit

register.description: This register is a read-only and shows the current rail requestor whose request is being granted and the current value of the counter associated with this requestor.

bitfield.description: Indicates Current Rail Requestor being processed by GPSC
Indicates the current rail counter value

register.description: This register is user programmable. It holds the counter values for rail counter. User can select one of the two counter values to be used for each power domain (see RAILSEL register).
User can use this register to select the counter value (RAILCTL) for each power domain.

bitfield.description: Rail Counter Select for Power Domain

register.description: This is a pseudo-command register with no actual storage. Reads return 0. One bit for each power domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).
This is a status register. One bit for each power domain (index 0 for domains 0-31, index 1 for domains 32-63, etc.).

bitfield.description: Power Domain n Transition Command Status

register.description: This is a status register. One register per power domain. Each register contains the status for the given power domain.
This is a control register. One register per power domain.

bitfield.description: External Power Control Power Good Indication

register.description: This is a status register. It shows PSC settings for easy debug.
This is a constant register showing some PSC settings for easy debug. This register is read only.

bitfield.description: Indicates which power domain this module belongs to
0: This LPSC supports all modes, 1: This LPSC supports Enable, AutoSleep or AutoWake only
0: This LPSC does not support Reset Isolation, 1: This LPSC supports Reset Isolation
0: MDCTL.NEXT field is writable, 1: MDCTL.NEXT field is locked
Number of PWR_SCR_DISABLE interfaces required on LPSC
Number of PWR_CLK_EN interfaces required on LPSC
Number of PWR_CLKSTOP interfaces required on LPSC

register.description: This register shows the status of each module. Requires one register per module on the device.

bitfield.description: Emulation Alters Module State. Inhibits Module Inactive or Force Module Active.
Module local reset initialization done status
These bits indicate the current module state

register.description: This register provides specific control for the individual module. One register per module on the device.

bitfield.description: Emulation Alters Module State. Inhibits Module Inactive or Force Module Active.
